sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: REAR VAULT (Fr. arri√®re voussure), the term in architecture employed for the vault of the internal hood of a doorway or window to which a splay has been given on the reveal; sometimes the vaulting surface is terminated by a small rih known as the scoinson rib (q.v.), and a further development is given by angle shafts carrying this rib, known as scoinson shafts.
